div1.p: Glennan confidentially informs Carter of a possible detail in Hawaii.

div1.head: Letter from A. H. Glennan to Henry Rose Carter, July 31, 1911
div1.opener:
strictly confidential
TREASURY DEPARTMENT,
BUREAU OF
PUBLIC HEALTH AND MARINE-HOSPITAL SERVICE,
WASHINGTON, D. C.,
July 31/11
Dear Doctor Carter
div1.p:
I have had your letter
for some time relative to
your readiness for any
special detail but have
waited in order to write
you something definite
There has been a little
cholera excitement in Boston
v New York. but the
bacteriologists of the service
have cinched the situation
so far.

A request has come in from
the Governor of Hawaii for
an officer of the service to
advise upon sanitary
matters. I do not know
just now what will come
of it. but I imagine that
you could have this
special detail. It is
strictly confidential so
far.

Our present bill, pay only,
is the one that has a chance
to pass Congress. Do not
go astray on this.

I am very fond of roses and
I know what beautiful
ones you had at New
Orleans. While bills see
they are running out there
the is here looking after
the bill
